verses.verse: These are also proverbs <WH4912> of Solomon <WH8010>, which the men <WH582> of Hezekiah <WH2396> king <WH4428> of Judah <WH3063> copied out <WH6275>.
It is the glory <WH3519> of God <WH430> to conceal <WH5641> a thing <WH1697>: but the honour <WH3519> of kings <WH4428> is to search out <WH2713> a matter <WH1697>.
The heaven <WH8064> for height <WH7312>, and the earth <WH776> for depth <WH6011>, and the heart <WH3820> of kings <WH4428> is unsearchable <WH2714>. is: Heb. there is no searching
Take away <WH1898> the dross <WH5509> from the silver <WH3701>, and there shall come forth <WH3318> a vessel <WH3627> for the finer <WH6884>.
Take away <WH1898> the wicked <WH7563> from before <WH6440> the king <WH4428>, and his throne <WH3678> shall be established <WH3559> in righteousness <WH6664>.
Put not forth <WH1921> thyself in the presence <WH6440> of the king <WH4428>, and stand <WH5975> not in the place <WH4725> of great <WH1419> men: Put: Heb. Set not out thy glory

For better <WH2896> it is that it be said <WH559> unto thee, Come up <WH5927> hither; than that thou shouldest be put lower <WH8213> in the presence <WH6440> of the prince <WH5081> whom thine eyes <WH5869> have seen <WH7200>.
Go not forth <WH3318> hastily <WH4118> to strive <WH7378>, lest thou know not what to do <WH6213> in the end <WH319> thereof, when thy neighbour <WH7453> hath put thee to shame <WH3637>.
Debate <WH7378> thy cause <WH7379> with thy neighbour <WH7453> himself; and discover <WH1540> not a secret <WH5475> to another <WH312>: a secret: or, the secret of
Lest he that heareth <WH8085> it put thee to shame <WH2616>, and thine infamy <WH1681> turn not away <WH7725>.
A word <WH1697> fitly <WH212> <WH655> spoken <WH1696> is like apples <WH8598> of gold <WH2091> in pictures <WH4906> of silver <WH3701>. fitly: Heb. spoken upon his wheels
As an earring <WH5141> of gold <WH2091>, and an ornament <WH2481> of fine gold <WH3800>, so is a wise <WH2450> reprover <WH3198> upon an obedient <WH8085> ear <WH241>.

As the cold <WH6793> of snow <WH7950> in the time <WH3117> of harvest <WH7105>, so is a faithful <WH539> messenger <WH6735> to them that send <WH7971> him: for he refresheth <WH7725> the soul <WH5315> of his masters <WH113>.
Whoso <WH376> boasteth <WH1984> himself of a false <WH8267> gift <WH4991> is like clouds <WH5387> and wind <WH7307> without rain <WH1653>. of a: Heb. in a gift of falsehood
By long <WH753> forbearing <WH639> is a prince <WH7101> persuaded <WH6601>, and a soft <WH7390> tongue <WH3956> breaketh <WH7665> the bone <WH1634>.
Hast thou found <WH4672> honey <WH1706>? eat <WH398> so much as is sufficient <WH1767> for thee, lest thou be filled <WH7646> therewith, and vomit <WH6958> it.

Withdraw <WH3365> thy foot <WH7272> from thy neighbour's <WH7453> house <WH1004>; lest he be weary <WH7646> of thee, and so hate <WH8130> thee. Withdraw: or, Let thy foot be seldom in weary: Heb. full of thee
A man <WH376> that beareth <WH6030> false <WH8267> witness <WH5707> against his neighbour <WH7453> is a maul <WH4650>, and a sword <WH2719>, and a sharp <WH8150> arrow <WH2671>.
Confidence <WH4009> in an unfaithful man <WH898> in time <WH3117> of trouble <WH6869> is like a broken <WH7465> tooth <WH8127>, and a foot <WH7272> out of joint <WH4154>.

As he that taketh away <WH5710> a garment <WH899> in cold <WH7135> weather <WH3117>, and as vinegar <WH2558> upon nitre <WH5427>, so is he that singeth <WH7891> songs <WH7892> to an heavy <WH7451> heart <WH3820>.
If thine enemy <WH8130> be hungry <WH7457>, give him bread <WH3899> to eat <WH398>; and if he be thirsty <WH6771>, give him water <WH4325> to drink <WH8248>:
For thou shalt heap <WH2846> coals of fire <WH1513> upon his head <WH7218>, and the LORD <WH3068> shall reward <WH7999> thee.

The north <WH6828> wind <WH7307> driveth away <WH2342> rain <WH1653>: so doth an angry <WH2194> countenance <WH6440> a backbiting <WH5643> tongue <WH3956>. driveth: or, bringeth forth rain: so doth a backbiting tongue an angry countenance
It is better <WH2896> to dwell <WH3427> in the corner <WH6438> of the housetop <WH1406>, than with a brawling <WH4079> <WH4066> woman <WH802> and in a wide <WH2267> house <WH1004>.
As cold <WH7119> waters <WH4325> to a thirsty <WH5889> soul <WH5315>, so is good <WH2896> news <WH8052> from a far <WH4801> country <WH776>.
A righteous <WH6662> man falling down <WH4131> before <WH6440> the wicked <WH7563> is as a troubled <WH7515> fountain <WH4599>, and a corrupt <WH7843> spring <WH4726>.
It is not good <WH2896> to eat <WH398> much <WH7235> honey <WH1706>: so for men to search <WH2714> their own glory <WH3519> is not glory <WH3519>.
He <WH376> that hath no rule <WH4623> over his own spirit <WH7307> is like a city <WH5892> that is broken down <WH6555>, and without walls <WH2346>.
